verses.text_plain: Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?
verses.verse_html:
1Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling? ▼
▼ an appointed…: or, a warfare

footnotes.body_html: ▼ an appointed…: or, a warfare

verses.text_plain: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:
verses.verse_html:
2As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work: ▼
▼ earnestly…: Heb. gapeth after

footnotes.body_html: ▼ earnestly…: Heb. gapeth after

verses.text_plain: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
verses.verse_html: 3So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

tokens.text: So am I made to possess

verses.text_plain: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
verses.verse_html:
4When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day. ▼
▼ the night…: Heb. the evening be measured?

tokens.text: unto the dawning of the day

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the night…: Heb. the evening be measured?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the night…: Heb. the evening be measured?

verses.text_plain: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
verses.verse_html: 5My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

verses.text_plain: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.
verses.verse_html: 6My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

verses.text_plain: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.
verses.verse_html:
7O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good. ▼
▼ shall…: Heb. shall not return
 , ▼
▼ see: to see, that is, to enjoy

footnotes.body_html: ▼ shall…: Heb. shall not return

footnotes.body_text: ▼ see: to see, that is, to enjoy
footnotes.body_html: ▼ see: to see, that is, to enjoy

verses.text_plain: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
verses.verse_html:
8The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not. ▼
▼ I am…: that is, I can live no longer

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I am…: that is, I can live no longer
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I am…: that is, I can live no longer

verses.text_plain: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.
verses.verse_html: 9As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.

verses.text_plain: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
verses.verse_html: 10He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

verses.text_plain: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.verse_html: 11Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.text_plain: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?
verses.verse_html: 12Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

verses.text_plain: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;
verses.verse_html: 13When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;

verses.text_plain: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:
verses.verse_html: 14Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

verses.text_plain: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.
verses.verse_html:
15So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life. ▼
▼ life: Heb. bones

verses.text_plain: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.
verses.verse_html: 16I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.

verses.text_plain: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?
verses.verse_html: 17What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

tokens.text: him? and that thou shouldest set

verses.text_plain: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?
verses.verse_html: 18And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?

verses.text_plain: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
verses.verse_html: 19How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

tokens.text: from me, nor let me alone

verses.text_plain: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
verses.verse_html: 20I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

tokens.text: against thee, so that I am a burden

verses.text_plain: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.
verses.verse_html: 21And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.

tokens.text: And why dost thou not pardon
and thou shalt seek me in the morning
